text:
Harold "Harry" Landers (born Harold Sorokin; September 3, 1921 – September 10, 2017) was an American actor. He was born in New York City, New York. He was known for his roles in "Up Periscope" (1959), "The Gallant Hours" (1960), and the Elvis Presley western "Charro!" (1969).
On January 4, 2018, it was announced that Landers died on September 10, 2017 in Calabasas, California of natural causes at the age of 96.
